newsitem.title: UK: UK roadworks suspended for Xmas, New Year.
newsitem.headline: UK roadworks suspended for Xmas, New Year.

text.p: Britain's Highways Agency said it was suspending many roadworks on motorways and major roads for the Christmas and New Year period.
Among the roadworks mentioned by the Highways Agency --

A13/A406, LB Newham, Canning Town Roundabout: There will be a lane closure on the westbound slip road from the Roundabout to the A13 westbound; this work is part of the Jubilee Line Extension project A406 LB Barnet, North Circular Road (east of Falloden Way): two lanes will be kept open on both carriageways during the holiday period.

Berkshire:M4 Jct 7 to 8/9 and A329M (over M4 Jct. 10): Roadworks suspended and all traffic management removed. Berkshire/Wiltshire:M4 Jcts. 12 to 15:Roadworks are suspended and traffic management will be removed except for hard shoulder closures which will remain for safety reasons.

Bristol:M5 J18/19:Avonmouth widening work is suspended from 21 December until 6 January, however traffic management will remain in place for safety reasons. Devon:A38, Goodstone - Peartree & Lime Kiln - Haldon: Roadworks are suspended and traffic management will be removed during the holiday period.

Hampshire:M27 Jct. 8-10: Roadworks suspended from 21 December to 6 January, all traffic management will be removed. Kent:A249, M2 - Iwade: Road works are suspended from 20 December until 6 January, but traffic management will remain at Key Street Roundabout.

Oxfordshire: There are no roadworks over the holiday period. Surrey: M23 Jcts 8-9: Roadworks are suspended and all traffic management will be removed from 24 December until 3 January, when a new contraflow will be installed. M25 Jcts 7-8: Work is suspended from Friday 20 December until Monday 6 January, three lanes will be open at all times during holiday period.

M25 Jcts 8-10: Contraflow will be suspended from 21 December until 2 January, two lanes will be available on both carriageways. A3/A31, south of Guildford: The temporary bridge over the A31 will remain in place; cones, speed restrictions and diversions will remain in force.
